definition: to attend simultaneously to two or more things/to balance (career and family, family and education etc)
double/twice/simultaneous/holding two or more (official) posts at the same time
surname Gu
to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to
an overall plan taking into account all factors
to adequately take into account both public and private interests

sentences.english: Compared with other methods, this approach has better overall consideration.
sentences.chinese: 與有關方法比較，該方法具有很好的統籌兼顧性。

sentences.english: Takes a personal interest that things are done right.
sentences.chinese: 兼顧了個人興趣，事情就好辦多了。

sentences.english: "Sudden leap" is not only the literal quaint, but both sound and meaning.
sentences.chinese: “趵突”不僅字面古雅，而且音義兼顧。

sentences.english: That L2 learners are instructed to notice forms feature will facilitate the acquisition of FMCs.
sentences.chinese: 如能讓學習者兼顧形式特徵，會有利於二語習得。

sentences.english: Besides, this article uses physically-based dynamic simulation method to model garment draping.
sentences.chinese: 同時兼顧到計算效率，也結合幾何方法模擬服裝褶皺。

sentences.english: Effective cash administration must take both liquidity and earning efficiency into account.
sentences.chinese: 有效的現金管理是必須兼顧其流動性與獲利性。

sentences.english: All security considerations have to exist on the spectrum between convenience and protection.
sentences.chinese: 所有安全性考慮必須兼顧方便和保護。

sentences.english: I'm a two-way player, I defend and attack.
sentences.chinese: 我相信自己能夠在防守和進攻兩方面同時兼顧。

sentences.english: Your objective should be to have good and balanced progress in all four facets.
sentences.chinese: 你的目標應當兼顧和平衡好以上的四個方面。

sentences.english: The committee found a middleground between the two proposals.
sentences.chinese: 委員會在兩方提案中採取了兩面兼顧的決定。

sentences.english: The plan of materials selection for OCTG needs to be made based on consideration of both the technical requirements and the economic benefits.
sentences.chinese: 石油管材的選擇方案應兼顧技術要求和經濟效益。

sentences.english: He juggled work with full time schooling.
sentences.chinese: 他工作的同時兼顧學業。

sentences.english: It still has to be entertaining, right?. - Yeah.
sentences.chinese: 還是要兼顧娛樂效果，對吧？

sentences.english: In addition to non-proliferation issues, attention of the GGE should also be focused on arms control and disarmament matters.
sentences.chinese: 在關注防擴散問題的同時，也應兼顧軍控和裁軍。

sentences.english: Fourth, adopt a holistic approach for comprehensive and balanced growth.
sentences.chinese: 第四，統籌兼顧，實現全面均衡發展。

sentences.english: But spending cuts must be balanced with more reforms to our tax code.
sentences.chinese: 但是削減開支必須統籌兼顧，競選更多的稅法改革。

definition: at the same time/simultaneously
to display/to exhibit/to bring out implicit or innate qualities/to express (a thought or moral)/to develop (an idea)/to elaborate (on a theme)
to appeal/to demand (an answer)/requirement/demand/claim/appeal/(marketing) message
steady/stable/stability/to stabilize/to pacify
to coordinate/to harmonize/to fit together/to match (colors etc)/harmonious/concerted
category
to emphasize (a statement)/to stress
both sides
to present clearly/to give prominence to/to magnify/clear and obvious
aspect/facet/level (political, psychological, spiritual etc)/(geology) bedding plane
not only (this one)/not just (...) but also
to defend/to safeguard/to protect/to uphold/to maintain
diverse/diversity/manifold
long-term/long-range
optimization/to optimize/to make superior
whole entity/entire body/synthesis/as a whole (situation, construction, team etc)/global/macrocosm/integral/holistic/whole
